question: Which country's pre-Columbian Mesoamerican archaeological site is "La Blanca"?
explanation: La Blanca is a pre-Columbian Mesoamerican archaeological site in present-day La Blanca, San Marcos Department, western Guatemala. It has an occupation dating predominantly from the Middle Preclassic (900â€“600 BC) period of Mesoamerican chronology. This site belongs to the later period of the Mokaya culture.
